sen.j: 加判（かはん）とは、加判の列とも呼び、本来の意味は主君の上意を執行するにあたって、署名・押捺を行う職権を有する重臣をいう。
sen.e: Kahan, also called Kahan no retsu (joint surety) means originally a chief retainer who had authority to sign or put seal at carrying out an order of a lord.
Kahan, also called Kahan no retsu (joint surety) means originally a chief retainer who had authority to sign or put seal at carrying out an order of a lord.
Kahan, also called Kahan no retsu (joint surety) means originally a chief retainer who had authority to sign or put seal at carrying out an order of a lord.

sen.j: 戦国時代末期からよく見られるようになった語である。
sen.e: The word was often seen since the end of Edo period.
The word had often been seen since the end of the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).
sen.cmt: was often seen →had often been seenに時制を訂正しました。Edo period→誤訳のためthe Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States)に訂正しました。
sen.e: The word had often been seen since the end of the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).

sen.j: 加判の意味は、江戸幕府・諸大名・旗本などによって、まちまちに用いられた。
sen.e: The word Kahan was used in various means by the Edo Shogunate, territorial lords, hatamoto and others.
The word Kahan was used in various meanings by the Edo Shogunate, territorial lords, hatamoto and others.
sen.cmt: means→meaningsに訂正しました。（文法上）
sen.e: The word Kahan was used in various meanings by the Edo Shogunate, territorial lords, hatamoto and others.

sen.j: 江戸幕府にあっては老中が加判の列であるが、当初は勘定奉行など評定所に出席できる資格の有する者も、加判であるとされた時期もあった。
sen.e: In the Shogunate, roju (senior councillor of the Tokugawa shogunate) was kahan no retsu, but in the beginning those who were qualified to attend in Hyojosho (conference chamber) such as kanjo bugyo (commissioner of finance) were also considered as kahan.

In the Edo Shogunate, roju (senior councillor of the Tokugawa shogunate) was kahan no retsu, but in the beginning those who were qualified to attend Hyojosho (conference chamber) such as kanjo bugyo (commissioner of finance) were also considered as kahan.
sen.cmt: the Shogunate→誤訳のためthe Edo Shogunateに訂正しました。attend in→attendに訂正しました。（文法上）
sen.e: In the Edo Shogunate, roju (senior councillor of the Tokugawa shogunate) was kahan no retsu, but in the beginning those who were qualified to attend Hyojosho (conference chamber) such as kanjo bugyo (commissioner of finance) were also considered as kahan.

sen.j: 諸藩にあっては、次のような用いられかたがされている。
sen.e: Kahan was used as follows in domains.
Kahan was used as follows in domains.
Kahan was used as follows in domains.

sen.j: 1，加判（あるいは加判衆）とは、家老と同義、または家柄・家格の名称として用いられることがあった。
sen.e: Kahan (or Kahanshu) was used as the name of the social standing of a family and kakaku (family status).
1. Kahan (or Kabanshu) was used for the same meaning as karo (chief retainer), or as the name of the social standing of a family and kakaku (family status).
sen.cmt: 「1.」を補足しました。Kahanshu→誤訳のためKabanshuに訂正しました。「家老と同義」の訳漏れを訂正しました。
sen.e: 1. Kahan (or Kabanshu) was used for the same meaning as karo (chief retainer), or as the name of the social standing of a family and kakaku (family status).

sen.j: 2，加判とは、評定所（会所）などの重臣会議に出席資格がある者に与えられる職名として、用いられることがあった。
sen.e: 2. Kahan was used as an official title given to qualified people to attend in a conference of chief retainer such as Hyojosho (conference chamber).
2. Kahan was sometimes used as an official title given to qualified people to attend a conference of chief retainers such as Hyojosho (conference chamber).
sen.cmt: 原文の「用いられることがあった」の表現に合うようwas used→was sometimes usedに訂正しました。attend in→attendに訂正しました。（文法上）chief retainer→chief retainersに訂正しました。
sen.e: 2. Kahan was sometimes used as an official title given to qualified people to attend a conference of chief retainers such as Hyojosho (conference chamber).

sen.j: この場合は、家老職が加判であることは当たり前であるため、それより下の役職の者（奉行・用人など）が任命されると加判を称した。
sen.e: In such a case, position of Karo (chief retainers) was naturally kahan, so people in lower positions (Bugyo [magistrate], yonin [officer handling domestic economy]) were called kahan at the assignment.
In such a case, position of karo was naturally kahan, so people in lower positions (bugyo [magistrate], yonin [officer handling domestic economy]) were called kahan at the assignment.
sen.cmt: 家老の()内の説明は既出であるため削除しました。Karo→karo、Bugyo→bugyoに訂正しました。（他の用語との統一）
sen.e: In such a case, position of karo was naturally kahan, so people in lower positions (bugyo [magistrate], yonin [officer handling domestic economy]) were called kahan at the assignment.

sen.j: 3，一般的ではないが、家老職の員数が、藩の規模より多い藩では、加判たる家老職と、加判の資格がない家老職とに分けた例がある。
sen.e: 3. There was uncommon example in a domain which had more positions of Karo than the size of domain that Karo qualified as kahan and karo unqualified as kana were classified.
3. There was uncommon example in a domain which had more positions of karo than the size of domain that karo qualified as kahan and karo unqualified as kahan were separated.
sen.cmt: Karo→karoに訂正しました。（他の用語との統一）kana→スペルミスのためkahanに訂正しました。classified→原文の意味により近いseparatedに訂正しました。
sen.e: 3. There was uncommon example in a domain which had more positions of karo than the size of domain that karo qualified as kahan and karo unqualified as kahan were separated.

sen.j: 4，家老の家柄である者が家老本職となると、家老加判とし、家老の家柄でない者が家老となると加判の資格のない家老職とされることがあった。
sen.e: 4. Those who were from karo family became karo kahan and those who from non karo family became karo without qualification of kahan.

4. Sometimes, those who were from karo family were regarded as karo kahan when they became professional karo, and those who were from non karo family were regarded as karo without qualification of kahan when they became karo.
sen.cmt: 「家老本職となると」、「家老となると」「とされることがあった」の訳漏れを訂正しました。「とし」「とされる」の訳のbecame→原文の意味により近いwere regarded asに訂正しました。（二箇所）who from→who were fromに訂正しました。（文法上）
sen.e: 4. Sometimes, those who were from karo family were regarded as karo kahan when they became professional karo, and those who were from non karo family were regarded as karo without qualification of kahan when they became karo.

sen.j: また幕府の旗本にあっては、その家臣筆頭の役職が、家老ではなく用人であることが多く、この場合の用人は加判である。
sen.e: In case of hatamato of bakufu, the highest rank of vassal was often not karo but yonin and if that was the case, the yonin was kahan.
As for hatamoto of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), the highest rank of vassal was often not karo but yonin and in this case, the yonin was kahan.
sen.cmt: In case of→原文の意味により近いAs forに訂正しました。hatamato→スペルミスのためhatamotoに訂正しました。bakufu→()内の説明を補足しました。if that was the case→「もしそうだとしたら」という仮定法の意味になってしまうためin this caseに訂正しました。
sen.e: As for hatamoto of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), the highest rank of vassal was often not karo but yonin and in this case, the yonin was kahan.
